case.name: NBBL v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs [2006] FCA 1616 (23 November 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: consideration of the exercise of the power conferred by s 426a
consideration of the principles informing the exercise of the discretion

consideration of whether an obligation arises in the refugee review tribunal to adjourn or reschedule a hearing upon the failure of the applicant to appear in circumstances where the applicant has expressed a desire to appear.
history of litigation in the refugee review tribunal, federal court and high court involving husband wife and two sons as applicants for refugee status
earlier segments of litigation favourable to appellants
ultimate proceedings in federal court at first instance pursued unsuccessfully by present appellants
objection to competency of ultimate application for leave to review or appeal from federal court decision at first instance
issues raised on ultimate application for leave to appeal addressed in any event
all issues resolved in favour of minister
